name: Titanium.UI.TableViewRow
summary: A table view row is an individual item in a table, organized into table view sections.

events.name: touchstart
events.summary: Fired as soon as the device detects a touch gesture against this view.
events.description: On Android and iOS, be aware that a row or table touch event and a table scroll event cannot occur concurrently. If a table begins to scroll during a touch event, the appropriate row or table touchcancel event fire before the scroll event begins.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: touchcancel
events.summary: Fired when a touch gesture is interrupted by the device.
events.description:
Generated in various circumstances, including an incoming call to allow the UI to clean up state.

On Android and iOS, be aware that a row or table touch event and a table scroll event cannot occur concurrently. If a table begins to scroll during a touch event, the appropriate row or table touchcancel event fire before the scroll event begins.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: touchend
events.summary: Fired when a touch gesture is complete.
events.description: On Android and iOS, be aware that a row or table touch event and a table scroll event cannot occur concurrently. If a table begins to scroll during a touch event, the appropriate row or table touchcancel event fire before the scroll event begins.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

events.name: click
events.summary: Fired when a table row is clicked by the user.
events.description:
There is a subtle difference between singletap and click events.

A singletap event is generated when the user taps the screen briefly without moving their finger. This gesture will also generate a click event.

However, a click event can also be generated when the user touches, moves their finger, and then removes it from the screen.

On Android, a click event can also be generated by a trackball click.

properties.name: detail
properties.summary: Indicates whether the detail button was clicked. Only true if row.hasDetail is true and the detail button was clicked.

properties.name: index
properties.summary: Row index.

properties.name: row
properties.summary: Table view row object.

properties.name: rowData
properties.summary: Dictionary containing the properties set on the row.

properties.name: searchMode
properties.summary: Boolean to indicate if the table is in search mode.

properties.name: section
properties.summary: Table view section object, if the clicked row is contained in a section.

properties.name: x
properties.summary: X coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: y
properties.summary: Y coordinate of the event from the source view's coordinate system.

properties.name: bubbles
properties.summary: True if the event will try to bubble up if possible.

properties.name: cancelBubble
properties.summary: Set to true to stop the event from bubbling.

properties.name: source
properties.summary: Source object that fired the event.

properties.name: type
properties.summary: Name of the event fired.

properties.name: accessibilityLabel
properties.summary: A succint label associated with the table row for the device's accessibility service.
properties.description: See accessibilityLabel description.

properties.name: backgroundSelectedColor
properties.summary: Background color to render when the row is selected, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: backgroundSelectedImage
properties.summary: Background image to render when the row is selected.
properties.description:
For normal views, the selected background is only used if focusable is true.

If backgroundSelectedImage is undefined, and the normal background image backgroundImage is set the normal image is used when this view is selected.

properties.name: className
properties.summary: Class name for the row.
properties.description:
A class name represents a unique row layout.

A table view row must have a unique class name if the row layout is unique. However, use the same name for rows that have the same structural layout (even if the content is different) to provide maximum rendering performance.

For example, if some rows include images and some rows do not, you would have two class names, one for image rows and one for plain rows.

This property exists on iOS, but is ignored.

properties.name: color
properties.summary: Default text color of the row when not selected, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description:
For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

On Android, the default text color is black if the background color is closer to white otherwise the default text color is white also selectedColor is not supported so the text is always displayed in this color.

properties.name: deleteButtonTitle
properties.summary: Text to display on the delete button when editable is enabled
properties.description: When editable is enabled on the TableViewRow, use this property to change the title of the delete button.

properties.name: editable
properties.summary: Determines the rows' editable behavior, which allows them to be deleted by the user when the table is in editing or moving mode.
properties.description:
If this property is not explicitly set, it will return undefined and the row's editable behavior will be determined by its parent table's editable property.

See the Titanium.UI.TableView description section for a full explanation of the TableView's row editing and moving modes.

If you want to change the title of the delete button, use the [deleteButtonTitle](Titanium.UI.TableViewRow.deleteButtonTitle] property

properties.name: font
properties.summary: Font to use for the row title.

properties.name: footer
properties.summary: The footer title of the row.
properties.description: The footer property is used to assign a footer title to a row. It has the same effect as setting the footerTitle property of a Titanium.UI.TableViewSection.

properties.name: footerTitle
properties.summary: The footer title of the row.
properties.description: The footerTitle property is used to assign a footer title to a row. It has the same effect as setting the footerTitle property of a Titanium.UI.TableViewSection.

properties.name: hasCheck
properties.summary: Determines whether a system-provided checkmark is displayed on the right-hand side of the row.

properties.name: hasChild
properties.summary: Determines whether a system-provided arrow is displayed on the right-hand side of the row.
properties.description:
The hasChild flag is used to indicate to the user that clicking on the row displays more detailed information.

On iOS, this is specifically used when clicking on the row navigates to the next table view in a heirarchy of table views.

properties.name: hasDetail
properties.summary: Determines whether a system-provided detail disclosure button is displayed on the right-hand side of the row.
properties.description:
The hasDetail flag is used to indicate to the user that more details are available on the row.

Specifically on iOS the detail disclosure button indicates that clicking on the row results in a detail view of that item.

The detail property in the click event is set to true if the click occurred on the detail button itself, false if the click occurs anywhere else in the row.

For rows that have hasDetail set to false, the detail flag is always false.

properties.name: header
properties.summary: The header title of the row.
properties.description: The header property is used to assign a header title to a row. It has the same effect as setting the headerTitle property of a Titanium.UI.TableViewSection.

properties.name: headerTitle
properties.summary: The header title of the row.
properties.description: The headerTitle property is used to assign a header title to a row. It has the same effect as setting the headerTitle property of a Titanium.UI.TableViewSection.

properties.name: indentionLevel
properties.summary: Indention level for the row.
properties.description: Indentation values greater than 0 indent the row text.

properties.name: leftImage
properties.summary: Image to render in the left image area of the row, specified as a local path or URL.

properties.name: moveable
properties.summary: Determines the rows' moveable behavior, which allows them to be re-ordered by the user when the table is in editing or moving mode.
properties.description:
If this property is not explicitly set, it will return undefined and the row's moveable behavior will be determined by its parent table's moveable property.

See the Titanium.UI.TableView description section for a full explanation of the TableView's row editing and moving modes.

properties.name: opacity
properties.summary: Opacity of this view, from 0.0 (transparent) to 1.0 (opaque). Defaults to 1.0 (opaque).
properties.description: To set the opacity of a row on iOS, specify an aRGB value with the <Titanium.UI.TableViewRow.backgroundColor> property.

properties.name: rightImage
properties.summary: Image to render in the right image area of the row, specified as a local path or URL.

properties.name: selectedBackgroundColor

deprecated.notes: This property has been deprecated in favor of backgroundSelectedColor.

properties.summary: Background color to render when the row is selected, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: selectedBackgroundImage

deprecated.notes: This property has been deprecated in favor of backgroundSelectedImage.

properties.summary: Background image to render when the row is selected.

properties.name: selectedColor
properties.summary: Color of the row text when the row is selected, as a color name or hex triplet.
properties.description: For information about color values, see the "Colors" section of Titanium.UI.

properties.name: selectionStyle
properties.summary: Selection style constant to control the selection color.
properties.description: Specify one of the constants from <Titanium.UI.SELECTION_STYLE_*>.

properties.name: title
properties.summary: Text to display on the row.
properties.description: Do not specify if using views as children of the row.
